conclusion: Identify every process of the Stirling cycle in the P-V plot
A → B is isothermal expansion at high temperature TH (heat absorbed)
B → C is isochoric cooling; temperature falls from TH to TL
C → D is isothermal compression at low temperature TL (heat rejected)
D → A is isochoric heating; temperature rises from TL back to TH
Recall the microscopic meaning of the Maxwell-Boltzmann speed-distribution curve
For an ideal monatomic gas, the speed distribution is given by a specific formula
When T increases, the most-probable speed vmp shifts to the right
The distribution curve flattens out and broadens with higher T
The shape of the distribution curve depends only on T
Compare the microscopic states at D and at A
Along D → A, volume is constant but temperature increases from TL to TH
Since TL < TH, the temperature at A is higher than at D
Decide whether the distribution changes
Because the temperature is different, the Maxwell speed-distribution curve must change
Peak position vmp increases, peak value fmax decreases, tail becomes heavier
Isochoric implies n and V remain unchanged
Internal energy ΔU = nCvΔT > 0; therefore T increases
A higher T modifies every temperature-dependent quantity, including speed distribution
Final answer: Yes, the Maxwell–Boltzmann speed-distribution curve is altered
